noun.description: An ancient kingdom in Southeast Asia that reached the peak of its power in the 11th century, when it ruled over the entire Mekong valley from the capital at Angkor. It was destroyed by Thai conquests in the 12th and 14th centuries.
A native or inhabitant of the ancient Khmer kingdom.
A native or inhabitant of Cambodia.
The Mon-Khmer language that is the official language of Cambodia.

adjective.description: Relating to the Khmer peoples or their language.
